onGetHost().Description: Return the object that's currently hosting the fragment. If a @B_android#support#v4#app#Fragment_E@ is hosted by a @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentActivity_E@, the object returned here should be the same object returned from @B_android#support#v4#app#Fragment#getActivity_E@.

onSupportInvalidateOptionsMenu().Description: Invalidates the activity's options menu. See @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentActivity#supportInvalidateOptionsMenu_E@

onHasView().Description: Return true if the container holds any view.

onHasWindowAnimations().Description: Return true if there are window animations.

onFindViewById(int).Description: Return the view with the given resource ID. May return null if the view is not a child of this container.

ClassDesc: Integration points with the Fragment host. Fragments may be hosted by any object; such as an https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@. In order to host fragments, implement @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentHostCallback_E@, overriding the methods applicable to the host.
